sub_title: *open to new project / job / adventure* facilitating, educating, programme making, curating, community organizing:::building relationships through COLLECTIVE WANDERING
summary:
'How to develop solidarity alternatives to counterbalance the dominant neoliberal and capitalist systems that are part of our daily lives and nestle into our bodies and clothes, artistic practices and even education?'

Lenn Cox is a community organizer, designer, educator, programme maker and karateka. Graduated in 2020 from the ArtEZ MA Practice Held in Common, where she initiated and co-created the manual Collective Wandering: Hanging Out with Our Everyday Ecology. Cox explores solidarity economies by immersing herself in self-organised learning-working-living environments While engaging her clothes as correspondence, to carry the exchanges and stories she collects as a topic of conversation. Fashion, for Cox, is an embodied and relational practice rooted in everyday life. As educator and community organizer she initiates spaces and projects that facilitate collective learning.

Cox is the co-founder of SHIFT, a nomadic 24-hour unlearning school, and initiated in 2019 the z o m e r k a m p collective in which she explores and practices what it means to have a collective practice at this moment in time. As linen steward, Lenn learned how to grow, process and craft with a group our everyday textiles and garments by hand, with commoning as a guiding principle.
Cox lives in Arnhem (the Netherlands) and works wandering.

Keywords: social ecology, collective care, relational activism, intentional communities, alternative fashion practices, solidarity economies, collective wandering

Instagram @lenncox

treasury_media.title: COLLECTIVE WANDERING Hanging Out with Our Everyday Ecology
treasury_media.description: This is not a manual in the traditional sense, with linear instructions or guidelines – rather, it is a hopefully engaging and activating collection of insights, moments and encounters, experienced during my continuing artistic research On Tour. What started out as a solo adventure consciously evolved into a collaborative and collective journey. The intention of this manual is to inspire and support kindred individuals who are in search of an alternative rhythm of learning-working-living.

profile_languages.name: Dutch, English, German, and a bit of French,

education.field_of_study: Practice Held in Common, MA in Fine Art and Design

profile_positions.description: The Creative Industries Fund NL is the cultural fund for design, architecture, digital culture and any crossovers between them. As one of the six national cultural funds, they finance special and innovative projects, research and activities of designers, makers and cultural institutions in the creative industry.
profile_positions.title: Committee Member

profile_positions.description:
Which role can socially engaged (participatory) art and design practices play in the context of increasing gentrification?

Ruimtekoers Presents: The Akademieweek! 
During a special Akademieweek from May 16 to 20, made for and by tomorrow’s makers, we will together learn how makers engage participatory and performative methods and tools to contribute to equitable urban development.
The week takes place in Utrecht at location De Voorkamer. Each day we will organise workshops and interventions there facilitated by artists and designers: Tina Lenz, Cultural Workers Unite, De Voorkamer, and gruppe tag. Each workshop can be attended separately, or you can register for the entire week.
https://bureauruimtekoers.nl/akademie/agenda-akademie/

During the Akademieweek we create space to explore and experience the role of the artist within the context of gentrification. Because, how do you work as a participatory maker within these systemic challenges? How do you interact with all of those stakeholders and avoid that you become their instrument? And above all: how do you work together with residents, while they might have something else on their mind?
profile_positions.title: Program Maker at de Akademie

profile_positions.description:
Fonds Kwadraat is a revolving fund that offers talented artists and designers the opportunity to take out an interest-free loan of up to EUR 8.000 for the development, creation and presentation of new work.
A loan can be used for a national or international exhibition, a publication, the purchase of equipment or tools, a new website, participation in an artist-in-residency and so on.
profile_positions.title: Committee Member

profile_positions.description:
My curatorial nomadic practice ‘Collective Wandering’ explores self-organised social-ecological communities and collectives, which sprung from my need for more commonality in my practice and life, as well as my wondering about how to collectively build and live actual alternatives to the neoliberal capitalist systems that dominate our daily lives.

*publication*
In the spring of 2019 while participating in the ArtEZ MA programme Practice Held in Common, I began immersing myself in different self-organised communities and collectives in and around Europe. 
After experiencing various collective practices, I wanted to share my experiences and created the manual 'Collective Wandering: Hanging Out with Our Everyday Ecology'.[1] 

*z o m e r k a m p collective* 
From the core belief that our everyday ecology —starting with our own body—  is the place to start practising what it means to transform the systems we inhabit, I initiated the collective z o m e r k a m p in 2019. An assemblage of six women[2] which sprung from a need for more commonality in our professional practices and lives, wondering how to expand from I to We. Each of us has their own art and or design practice, based on a fashion background. Further common ground for the collective is that we all work in the field of education, in various forms. 
z o m e r k a m p explores what it means to have a collective practice at this moment in time. In the cultural field, which is indicative of society at large, we experience the urgency for skills based on love, care and cooperation, rather than burnout and competition. We share the insight and tools we assemble as a collective by hosting programmes and in the act of facilitating.
---------
[1] The publication is available among others via: WALTER books, San Serriffe, Warehouse, Framer Framed, rile*, Well Projects, Page Not Found, NAi Booksellers and Lenn Cox 
[2] Aliki van der Kruijs, Melanie Bomans, Sanne Karssenberg, Niki Milioni, Rosanne van Wijk and Lenn Cox
profile_positions.title: initiator, curator, facilitator

company.name: Collective Wandering:  Hanging Out with Our Everyday Ecology

profile_positions.company: Collective Wandering:  Hanging Out with Our Everyday Ecology
profile_positions.description:
In the spring of 2019 I began immersing myself in different self-organised communities and collectives in and around Europe. After experiencing various collective practices, I wanted to share them and created the publication[1] It is not a manual in the traditional sense, with linear instructions or guidelines; rather, it is a hopefully engaging collection of insights, moments and encounters, experienced during my continuing artistic research. The intention of this manual is to inspire and support kindred individuals who are in search of an alternative rhythm of learning-working-living, sharing multiform co-production processes of self-organisation concerning our common everyday lives.

Accompanying my own contributions, I have invited various practitioners who resonate with me on a personal and professional level to respond to our shared experiences, in relation to their respective practices. With contributions by Tigrilla Gardenia(Damanhur), Sepideh Ardalani(MASSIA), Jessica Gysel(Girls Like Us, Mothers & Daughters Bar), Tomboys Donʼt Cry, Lucas Meyer(Sanctuary Slimane), Katerina Tarnovska(Asgarda), Alya Hessy, Lucie Chaptal(we made together), Marlies van Hak, Aliki van der Kruijs, Guusje de Bruin, Melanie Bomans, Niki Milioni, Rosanne van Wijk, Sanne Karssenberg and Femke de Vries. Graphic design by Heike Renée de Wit.
The result is a textual and visual gathering of conversations, testimonials and observations, from essays to poetry, from clothing to recipes. I recognise the realisation of this publication as an extension of my curatorial nomadic practice, in which I initiate collaborative projects and co-facilitate spaces of collective care. This manual is such a space. I see it as a living document, an ongoing conversation. An open invitation to go on a collective adventure with your own everyday ecology.

[1] The publication is available among others via: WALTER books, San Serriffe, Warehouse, rile*, Well Projects, Page Not Found, NAi Booksellers and Lenn Cox
profile_positions.title: initiator

profile_positions.description:
Grassroots - A search for locally rooted initiatives

How can Grassroots connect to themes vital to the neighborhood, for humans, birds and grasses that are rooted there?

In September 2021 artist collective De Onkruidenier invited me as community connector of their new project ‘Grassroots’ in collaboration with A Tale of A Tub (space for contemporary art and culture in Rotterdam). To collectively research ways in which we can build renewed relationships with our environment. Can curiosity lead to collectivity? Could we (re)link to themes that live in the Spangen (Rotterdam) community from both a human and bird’s eye perspective? 

Within this collaboration I use my Clothing as Correspondence, to carry the exchanges, contacts and stories I collect with me as conversation piece.
Besides we developed a set Navigation Cards to map and activate our field research of social capital, found grasses, ecological values, bird perspectives, historical contexts and relationships between them, and as an attempt to oversee the various local and global actors in the Grassroots ecosystem. This Grassroots Cardsystem also function as a tool for A Tale of A Tub for upcoming community based projects.
profile_positions.title: community connector Grassroots

profile_positions.description:
The MA Practice Held in Common is an experiential, practice-based research environment and welcomes participants who share the urgency to engage the generative potential of their creative practice towards collective well-being and joy. The programme is open to practitioners from any field of practice.

*Learning by doing, learning by heart. Never walk when you can dance. How can I make life more wonderful?
*An experiential, practice-based research environment
*Participants are highly self-directed and motivated towards self-learning
*Educating for collective leadership based on self- management, self-organization and direct democracy
*A supportive community of peers and mentors to further explore and deepen your practice
*Participants curate a sequence of Immersive Learning Experiences with external partners
*Compassionate Communication is a core practice in the programme
*Communicate and act from what is truly alive in you
*Dynamic multi-disciplinary practice-based research environments such as The Linen Project and Take Back the Economy!
*Discipline transcending curriculum; participants from all creative disciplines are welcome
profile_positions.title: Mentor Practice Held in Common + program maker Practice Plan

profile_positions.description: Collectie Arnhem is a collective project in which third-year students of the Fashion Design bachelor at ArtEZ University of the Arts collaborate to develop, design and present their view on fashion. The project offers a laboratory-style environment where students research and explore diverse aspects of the process and the profession; questioning what fashion is and exploring what fashion can do + be.
profile_positions.title: tutor Collectie Arnhem @ArtEZ Fashion Design BA

profile_positions.description:
Curator of the Fashion Design ArtEZ exhibition as part of the HURRAY! MoBA 2013 exhibition.
"Hurray is the second largest exhibition of MoBA 2013. As a tribute to the fashion department of ArtEZ Institute of the Arts, which is celebrating 60 years. An exhibition with international renowned academies: ArtEZ Arnhem, Royal College of Art London, Central Saint Martins London, fashion academy of Antwerp, Polimoda Florence and more"
As well working on different projects such as exhibitions, shows and other exposures of ArtEZ Institute of the Arts
profile_positions.title: curator and producer events ArtEZ Institute of the Arts 2013 (freelance)

profile_positions.description:
The Art Business Centre has a strong ambition to bring creative talent to the attention while laying the foundation for themselves in the work field.
The Art Business Centre at ArtEZ Institute of the Arts wants to develop entrepreneurship in the creative sector. She does this by integrating entrepreneurship in education, support alumni and advise them when starting their business. In addition, the Art Business Centre is a mediator between the labor market and business. 
As a projectmanager I am developing concepts, curate projects, develop workshops, advise young creative entrepreneurs and mediate between creative- and the business field.
profile_positions.title: Projectmanager Art Business Centre
project leader Arnhem Coming Soon X Dutch Design Week 2012

profile_positions.description:
SHIFT is a nomadic 24-hour (unlearning)  ̶d̶e̶s̶i̶g̶n̶ school, moving independently and situationally around a program and a theme. For each new edition SHIFT invites a progressive practitioner as a tutor to develop a 24-hour scenario for one or more participants. The enactment of design around the human body is a core theme. During those 24 hours, design performance, research, collaboration, experiment, feedback loops and trial-and-error playfully take place. SHIFT creates a dynamic network through online registrations of editions.

SHIFT is a Parallel Playground / Bypass / Network of Workshops / Tool / Nomadic Academy / Interface / Exploring 24hr School / Historical Undergarment (according to Siri)
Playing Pilots
profile_positions.title: co-founder & curator

profile_positions.description:
Lenn Cox is a curator from the Netherlands with a specialism in fashion and design. 
Graduated in Fashion Design from ArtEZ University of the Arts Lenn decided to focus more on fashion in all its layers and manifestations in the past, present and future. 
She gives shape to projects by developing structures and rhythms, which creates space within a project to work and breathe - a living tissue.
As a junction maker she intuitively takes care (curare) of ideas and enjoys making them happen. Working closely with companies and individuals from multiple disciplines she creates intuitive visual stories, inspired by what lies ahead and what is grounded in history. She has worked on several ventures in which she has taken on the role of an exhibition maker, curator, art director, tutor, collector, connector, sparring-partner and creative organizer.  info@lenncox.nl
profile_positions.title: Fashion and Design Curator

profile_positions.description:
Presentation of ArtEZ Fashion Design curated by Lenn Cox at Beijing Design Week 2017 (28.09 - 06.10.2017)
An exhibition with various student- and graduation projects, presented in an installation by Beijing based designer Henny van Nistelrooy who will reflect on the theme #DNA.
Dreaming, the only thing that keeps us awake!
profile_positions.title: curator Dreams Need Air #DNA

volunteer_experiences.description:
A solidarity-based support network for self-employed entrepreneurs in the Netherlands.

The Broodfonds is a collective facility for incapacity to work (arbeidsongeschiktheid), developed by and for entrepreneurs. Often, this type of arrangement is also referred to as a ‘gift-circle’. 
A Broodfonds consists of a minimum of 20 to a maximum of 50 self-employed people, who know and trust each other. You support each other in case of illness. To do so, you set aside a fixed amount each month. Those who are ill for a long time receive donations from the others to live on. For a maximum of two years.
